SEA Games 2019: Soal Pelatnas, dari Busur Panah sampai Dana
04 Nov 2019, 03:07 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Kementerian Pemuda dan Olahraga dan Komite Olimpiade Indonesia bersepakat mengirimkan atlet dari 45 cabang ke SEA Games 2019 pada 30 November hingga 11 Desember di Filipina. Kontigen Indonesia ditargetkan meraih 45 medali emas. Dengan target tesebut, kontingen Merah Putih berharap masuk empat besar pesta olahraga Asia Tenggara itu.
Pelaksana Tugas Deputi IV Kemenpora, Yuni Purwanti, mengatakan cabang seperti bulu tangkis, angkat besi, atletik, dan renang diharap bisa mendulang banyak medali emas. "Untuk proyeksinya kebanyakan dari nomor Olympic, yang terbesar renang lima emas, atletik (4 emas), bulu tangkis (3 emas). Yang lainnya tidak lebih dari dua emas," ungkap dia, 8 Oktober 2019.
Dua hari setelah dilantik oleh Presiden Jokowi sebagai Menpora, Zainudin Amali langsung mengunjungi pemusatan latihan nasional atau pelatnas beberapa cabang olahraga untuk memastikan kesiapan atlet.
Lokasi pertama yang dikunjunginya adalah pelatnas atlet panahan di Lapangan Panahan Gelora Bung Karno, Senayan, Jakarta, Jumat, 25 Oktober 2019. Dalam kunjungan itu, ia sempat bertanya kepada atlet panahan Prima Wisnu dan rekan-rekannya terkait kendala yang dihadapi selama pelatnas SEA Games 2019.
Zainudin menegaskan akan berkonsentrasi pada cabang olahraga yang dipertandingkan di Olimpiade, Asian Games, dan SEA Games. Selama ini, kata dia, panahan selalu menyumbang medali di multicabang itu.
Ia mengatakan panahan menjadi cabang olahraga andalan Indonesia untuk bisa meraih posisi lima besar di SEA Games 2019. Ia pun optimistis panahan bisa menyabet medali sesuai target. "Kami optimistis panahan bisa menyumbang minimal empat medali emas," kata Menpora yang baru dilantik Rabu lalu itu. "Kalau panahan ini targetnya empat emas, pasti bisa sampai enam," dia menambahkan.
Dalam kesempatan itu, Ketua Umum Persatuan Panahan Indonesia (Perpani), Kelik Wirawan Widodo, menyampaikan kepada Menpora terkait kekurangan peralatan. Kata Kelik, saat ini satu atlet hanya memiliki satu busur. Bahkan, ada satu atlet yang peralatannya patah.
"Ini dalam diskusi pengurus dan tim manajer. Kami butuh alat baru untuk SEA Games 2019," kata Kelik. Perpani, kata Kelik, sudah memesan peralatan khusus. Ia memberikan catatan bahwa peralatan yang dibutuhkan atlet itu harus sesuai dengan postur tubuh atlet. "Satu busur itu Rp 56 juta," ujarnya.
Pada hari yang sama, Zainudin Amali juga menyambangi Stadion Madya yang merupakan lokasi Pelatnas Atletik. Ia bersama Ketua Komite Olimpiade Indonesia, Raja Sapta Oktohari, disambut oleh Ketua Pengurus Besar Persatuan Atletik Seluruh Indonesia (PB PASI), Bob Hasan.
Dalam kesempatan itu, Bob Hasan menyampaikan keluhan soal fasilitas latihan olahraga di kawasan Gelora Bung Karno (GBK) yang sekarang ini menjadi area komersial kepada Zainudin Amali.
"Problemnya sih ini stadion nih dibangun Pak Sukarno untuk bangun olahraga. Karena sekarang sudah jadi BLU (Badan Layanan Umum), digunakan untuk nyari duit. Jadi hotel, jadi mal," kata Bob Hasan.
PASI, kata dia, tidak berharap muluk-muluk. Dia hanya menginginkan agar para atlet atletik tetap bisa berlatih di kawasan GBK. "Kalau kami tidak bisa latihan, lalu kalah, ya tidak tahu deh harus bagaimana," kata dia.
Bob Hasan tak mempersoalkan fasilitas GBK disewakan secara komersial karena pengelolaannya memang sudah berbentuk Badan Layanan Umum. Kini kewenangan terhadap pengelolaan GBK bukan di Kemenpora tetapi Kementerian Keuangan.
"Kalau kami tidak bisa pakai ini, kami pindah ke Pakansari di Cibinong (Bogor), karena di UNJ (Universitas Negeri Jakarta) sudah rusak (lapangannya). Kami juga sedang nunggu stadion atletik di Ragunan," kata pria yang akrab disapa Om Bob ini.
Sebelumnya, PB PASI mengeluhkan soal lintasan atletik Stadion Madya, GBK, Senayan, Jakarta, yang kotor dan tercemari puntung rokok, paku, dan kabel, setelah digunakan untuk kegiatan Indonesia Drum Corps Championship pada 3-6 Oktober 2019.
Puntung rokok dan paku itu ditemukan oleh tim pelatnas atletik yang akan melakukan latihan persiapan SEA Games 2019 pada pagi harinya. Foto kondisi itu kemudian diunggah di akun Instagram @pasipusat.
Setelah mendengarkan keluhan dari Ketua PB PASI, Menpora berencana akan melakukan komunikasi langsung dengan Menteri Sekretaris Negara Pratikno. Ia berjanji akan mencarikan solusi supaya pembinaan olahraga di GBK tidak terganggu dengan status pengelolaan yang sudah BLU. "Dari informasi ini, tentu saya akan bicara dengan Mensesneg dulu. Kita cari jalan keluarnya. Saya belum bisa jawab sore ini," kata Zainudin, Jumat, 25 Oktober 2019.
"Semua masalah kita catat dulu. Kita tak bisa berikan jawaban tanpa solusinya. Ini bukan di Menpora kan, kalau dari Kemenpora yang bisa langsung putuskan, sore ini langsung saya cari solusinya," tuturnya.
Kunjungan Zainudin Amali kembali berlanjut pada 28 Oktober 2019, kali ini Pelatnas Angkat Besi di Wisma Kwini. Rombongan Menpora disambut Ketua Umum Pengurus Besar Persatuan Angkat Berat, Binaraga, dan Angkat Besi Seluruh Indonesia (PB PABBSI), Rosan P Roeslani dan Wakil Ketua Djoko Pramono.
Lifter Indonesia, Eko Yuli Irawan, berharap Menteri Pemuda dan Olahraga Zainudin Amali bisa membikin program kerja gebrakkan bagi cabang angkat besi dengan merujuk standar minimal dari era Imam Nahrawi.
"Untuk menteri baru kalau bisa bikin gebrakan. Kalau kemarin ada ketertinggalan, ada kekurangan dari pendanaan, kalau ada proposalnya yang turunnya agak lama, besok bisa dipercepat," katanya seusai mendapat kunjungan dari Zainudin Amali di Pelatnas Angkat Besi di Jalan Kwini, Jakarta, Senin, 28 Oktober 2019.
Menurut dia, Zainudin harus bisa memberikan perhatian tahun depan untuk persiapan Olimpiade 2020. Ia menyebutkan kebutuhan untuk persiapan Olimpiade jauh besar dari SEA Games 2019. "Kalau jumlah atlet tidak sebesar SEA Games," kata dia.
Saat mengunjungi Pelatnas Angkat Besi, Wakil Ketua Umum PB PABBSI, Djoko Pramono, sempat mengeluhkan keterlambatan pencairan dana dari Kemenpora kepada Zainudin. Ia menyebutkan masih beruntung keterlambatan pencairan dana tidak menganggu persiapan atlet karena masih bisa ditalangi oleh Ketua PB PABBSI Rosan P. Roeslani. "Untung masih ada Pak Rosan yang biasa memakai koceknya dulu," kata dia..Menanggapi keluhan dari PABBSI, Zainudin mengatakan sengaja di setiap kunjungan ke cabang olahraga membawa staf Kemenpora. Hal dilakukan supaya seluruh permasalahan bisa dicatat dan ditindaklanjuti. "Karena ini penggunaan APBN, ini uang negara, kita harus hati-hati. Saya sudah sampai ke teman-teman di Kemenpora, tidak boleh ada satu rupiah pun yang pengunaannya menyimpang," kata dia.

SEA Games 2019: About Pelatnas, from Arrows to Funds
Nov 04 2019, 03:07 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Ministry of Youth and Sports and the Indonesian Olympic Committee agreed to send athletes from 45 branches to the 2019 SEA Games on November 30 to December 11 in the Philippines. Kontigen Indonesia is targeted to win 45 gold medals. With that target, the Red and White contingent hopes to enter the top four of the Southeast Asian Games.
Acting Deputy of the Ministry of Youth and Sport, Yuni Purwanti, said branches such as badminton, weightlifting, athletics, and swimming were expected to gain a lot of gold medals. "Most of the projections are from Olympic numbers, the biggest are five gold swimming, athletic (4 gold), badminton (3 gold). The others are no more than two gold," he said, October 8, 2019.
Two days after being inaugurated by President Jokowi as Menpora, Zainudin Amali immediately visited the national training camps or several national training camps to ensure athlete readiness.
The first location he visited was the national archery athlete at the Bung Karno Archery Field, Senayan, Jakarta, Friday, October 25, 2019. During the visit, he had asked the Prima Wisnu archery athlete and his colleagues about the obstacles encountered during the 2019 SEA Games National Training event. .
Zainudin stressed he would concentrate on sports that were competed at the Olympics, Asian Games and SEA Games. During this time, he said, archery always contributed a medal in the multi-branch.
He said archery became the mainstay of Indonesian sports to be able to reach the top five positions at the 2019 SEA Games. He was optimistic that archery could snatch a medal on target. "We are optimistic that archery can contribute at least four gold medals," said the newly-appointed Menpora last Wednesday. "If this archery targets four gold, it can definitely reach six," he added.
On that occasion, the Chairperson of the Indonesian Archery Association (Perpani), Kelik Wirawan Widodo, conveyed to the Menpora related to the lack of equipment. Kelik said, currently one athlete only has one bow. In fact, there is one athlete whose equipment is broken.
"This is in the discussion of the management and team managers. We need a new tool for the 2019 SEA Games," Kelik said. Perpani, said Kelik, has ordered special equipment. He noted that the equipment needed by the athlete must be in accordance with the athlete's posture. "One bow is Rp. 56 million," he said.
On the same day, Zainudin Amali also visited the Madya Stadium which was the location of the Athletics Pelatnas. He was with the Chairman of the Indonesian Olympic Committee, Raja Sapta Oktohari, welcomed by the Chairman of the Great Board of the Athletics Association of Indonesia (PB PASI), Bob Hasan.
On that occasion, Bob Hasan expressed a complaint about sports training facilities in the Gelora Bung Karno (GBK) area which is now a commercial area to Zainudin Amali.
"The problem is that this stadium was built by Pak Sukarno to build sports. Because now it has become a BLU (Public Service Agency), used to look for money. Becoming a hotel, so it's a mall," said Bob Hasan.
PASI, he said, did not hope to be grandiose. He only wanted athletes to be able to train in the GBK area. "If we can't practice, then lose, then we don't know what to do," he said.
Bob Hasan did not question the GBK facilities being leased commercially because the management was already in the form of a Public Service Agency. Now the authority over the management of GBK is not in the Ministry of Youth and Sports but the Ministry of Finance.
"If we can't use this, we move to Pakansari in Cibinong (Bogor), because UNJ (Jakarta State University) has been damaged (the field). We are also waiting for the athletic stadium in Ragunan," said the man who is familiarly called Om Bob .
Previously, PB PASI had complained about the athletic track of Madya Stadium, GBK, Senayan, Jakarta, which was dirty and contaminated with cigarette butts, nails and cables, after being used for the Indonesia Drum Corps Championship on 3-6 October 2019.
Cigarette butts and nails were found by the athletic training team who will conduct preparations for the 2019 SEA Games in the morning. The condition photo was then uploaded to the @pasipusat Instagram account.
After listening to complaints from the Chairman of PB PASI, the Menpora plans to communicate directly with the Minister of State Secretary Pratikno. He promised to find a solution so that sports coaching in GBK would not be interrupted by the management status that had been BLU. "From this information, of course I will talk to the State Minister first. We will find a solution. I have not been able to answer this afternoon," Zainudin said, Friday, October 25, 2019.
"We will note all the problems first. We cannot give an answer without a solution. This is not at the Menpora, right? From the Ministry of Youth and Sports which can be immediately decided, this afternoon I immediately sought a solution," he said.
Zainudin Amali's visit continued on October 28, 2019, this time Pelatnas Weightlifting at Wisma Kwini. The Menpora delegation was welcomed by the General Chairperson of the All Indonesia Weight Lifting, Bodybuilding and Weightlifting Association (PB PABBSI), Rosan P Roeslani and Deputy Chair Djoko Pramono.
Lifter Indonesia, Eko Yuli Irawan, hopes that the Minister of Youth and Sports Zainudin Amali can make a work program for the weight lifting branch by referring to the minimum standards from the era of Imam Nahrawi.
"For new ministers, if you can make a breakthrough. If yesterday was left behind, there is a lack of funding, if there is a proposal that falls a bit longer, tomorrow can be accelerated," he said after receiving a visit from Zainudin Amali at the Weightlifting Pelatnas on Jalan Kwini, Jakarta, Monday. , 28 October 2019.
According to him, Zainudin should be able to pay attention next year to prepare for the 2020 Olympics. He mentioned the need for Olympic preparations is far greater than the 2019 SEA Games. "If the number of athletes is not as big as the SEA Games," he said.
When visiting Pelatnas Weightlifting, PB PABBSI Deputy Chairman, Djoko Pramono, had complained about the delay in disbursing funds from the Ministry of Youth and Sports to Zainudin. He said he was still fortunate that the delay in disbursing the funds did not disrupt athlete preparations because they could still be bailed out by PB PBABBSI chairman Rosan P. Roeslani. "Fortunately, there is still Mr. Rosan who used to wear his pockets first," he said ... Responding to complaints from PABBSI, Zainudin said deliberately at every visit to the sports branch bringing Kemenpora staff. This is done so that all problems can be recorded and acted upon. "Because this is the use of the State Budget, this is state money, we must be careful. I have reached friends in the Ministry of Youth and Sports, there should not be even a single rupiah that has deviated," he said.
